sentence.Network_en: The blade of this knife is so dull that it will not cut a radish.
sentence.Network_cn: 这把刀的刀刃太钝，不能切萝卜。

sentence.Network_en: A spicy , sharp - tasting radish was exactly what her stomach craved.
sentence.Network_cn: 她正馋着想吃一个香甜可口的红萝卜呢.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English rædic, from Latin radix, radic- 'root'

entry.tran: 小萝卜（可在色拉中生食）
entry.def: Radishes are small red or white vegetables that are the roots of a plant. They are eaten raw in salads.

means.word_mean: 2. pungent edible root of any of various cultivated radish plants
3. Eurasian plant widely cultivated for its edible pungent root usually eaten raw

sentences.en: We used to bury radishes under the soil to keep fresh and dig them up in time of need.
sentences.cn: 我们过去总是把萝卜埋在土里保鲜,随吃随挖。
